results.snippet: RIP Michael BTW I do not own any part of this Video PLEASE READ THIS !! Michael was not LYPSINC. For some odd reason when the video was uploaded to YT, the sound and the image didn't got synchro.

results.title: Moonwalk (dance) - Wikipedia
results.snippet: The moonwalk The moonwalk , or backslide, is a popping dance move in which the performer glides backwards but their body actions suggest forward motion. [1] It became popular around the world when American singer Michael Jackson performed the move during the performance of "Billie Jean" on Motown 25: Yesterday, Today, Forever, which was broadcast in 1983; he later incorporated it in tours and ...

results.title: Michael Jackson's Moonwalker Soundtrack : Michael Jackson : Free ...
results.snippet: Full soundtrack for the Genesis version of Michael Jackson's Moonwalker.

results.title: The moment Michael Jackson did his first moonwalk on TV and changed ...
results.snippet: It's been 40 years since Michael Jackson took the stage to perform his first moonwalk to an audience of 47 million people.

results.title: Moonwalk | Michael Jackson Wiki | Fandom
results.snippet: Moonwalking received widespread attention, and from then on, the moonwalk became Jackson's signature move for his song "Billie Jean". Nelson George said that Jackson's rendition "combined Jackie Wilson's athleticism with James Brown's camel walk." Jackson's autobiography was titled Moonwalk , and he also starred in a 1988 film titled Moonwalker.

1.summary:
- **Signature Move**: Michael Jackson popularized the moonwalk during his performance of "Billie Jean" on Motown 25 in 1983, where the dance move became his signature (Result 2, 5).
- **Cultural Impact**: The moonwalk not only showcased Jackson's unique style but also captivated a massive audience, with 47 million viewers witnessing his first televised performance of the move (Result 4).
- **Dance Technique**: The moonwalk is characterized by gliding backwards while appearing to move forwards, a technique that combines elements from earlier performers like Jackie Wilson and James Brown (Result 2, 5).
- **Legacy**: Jackson's influence extended beyond music; he published an autobiography titled "Moonwalk" and starred in a film called "Moonwalker," reinforcing the significance of the dance move (Result 5).
- **Technological Note**: Some videos of Jackson's performances, like the one shared on YouTube, note issues with audio and visual synchronization, which can affect viewer experience (Result 1).
